WRITING.TEXT:
My ex constantly calls me fat as an insult whenever we interact.
I never understood that, and still don't...because she was about 350 lbs when we were married. She ended up getting gastric bypass surgery, and now weighs about 100 lbs.
Why someone that once weighed that much would make fun of someone else that is heavy just confirms to me why she's my ex.

but we don't do well on grass.

WRITING.TITLE: [Rant] Help with scale!
WRITING.TEXT:
I already had one of those fancy-schmancy body measuring scales for at least two years...but once I started keto, I realized how inaccurate it was. (Yes, I did all my weighing on a hardwood floor, stable surface)
It would give vastly different weights from one measurement to the next, even taken right next to each other 10 seconds apart. I'm talking 10lbs differences.
I ended up getting rid of it, because I couldn't trust it, and bought a halfway decent electronic glass scale without all the bells and whistles...but I don't trust it now either! Over the past week, it's been giving be wildly different results, down 10 lbs one minute, up 10 lbs literally one minute later.
TL:DR - Can anyone suggest a reliable, dependable scale for me to purchase...that you have experience with already and that hasn't failed you? I'd really appreciate it!
Ohhh, ohhhh! Or, a years' subscription to a meat of the month club...in honor of Keto.
What about a premium spa package? Can include a note saying you hope to make her feel even a small percentage of the happiness she allowed you to feel.

Married for two years.... She was taken to hospital three years ago "When she was young"...
Hmmm, something fishy here. =)
I am surprised that Trump didn't offer a cabinet position to Snowden.

OMG. I've been lurking here and reading for a LONG time...and I always wondered what the heck the Discovery Channel Shark Week had to do with anything, and why people always talk about the end of it.
*lighbulb!!!*
No doubt! Buy that man/woman a thoughtful gift!

Why is it America's job to defend Eastern Europe?
It's not. It's America's job to uphold our agreement to support NATO, like all members in it are supposed to do.
When Trump gives a tiny middle finger to NATO when they ask for help with aggressive Russian Expansion, we will become pariahs in the international community and no one will trust us any longer.
It will go downhill from there.

Much of it is mental.
After I started, I thought I was hungry, but then when I distracted myself and thought about it a little later, I realized I wasn't hungry any more.
In my opinion, I was so used to eating all the time, and so much, I think that my brain was telling me that I SHOULD be hungry.
Now, when I (think I) feel hungry, I just do a quick self reflection and realize that I'm hungry because I'm BORED...and when I get back to not being bored, I quickly forget I was hungry. Living decades with eating when I'm bored is a hard habit to break. =)

Wait, don't chickens lay an egg a day? So you're getting three eggs a day? That seems eatable! =D
I might be wrong about the eggs/hen/day though...I'm just guessing. =)

As a recently retired Navy guy, my advice to you is...
Find a better partner to hold your ankles, if you catch my drift. =)
YEssssssss. I have wanted a stick blender for so long! Now I have a reason to go get one! =D Thanks, that sounds fantastic!

Take a low-carb tortilla or two, heat it up dry in a skillet until it's stiffer...spread a layer of guac over it, give it a sprinkle of shredded cabbage for a little texture and crunch in the bites....some shakes of hot sauce on it. Mmmmmm, and you'll fit in with everyone else.
haha, yes, thanks for sharing! Also just ordered.

Great story, thank you for sharing!
Thank you for your story! That was a great read and very uplifting.

WRITING.TITLE: Office is having a weight-loss competition!
WRITING.TEXT:
Just got an email this morning, one of the ladies in the office is putting together a $10 buy-in weight loss competition to run for 12 weeks, with the winner receiving a gift card in the amount of money that is collected. (Determined by % of total weight lost)
Holy cow, they don't stand a chance against this keto guy! ;)
I actually feel it's unfair, personally, so I emailed back and asked if I could just join the competition in a non buy-in fashion...and not be eligible for the prize if I won, but more as a "public" way to hold myself accountable.
Awesome NSV. =D

Whoa. That is drool-worthy!
What kind of nutritionals are in that one burrito? Cals/Carbs/Protein/Fat?

On the contrary..."most of the people" are NOT gluten sensitive or allergic. We're talking less than 5% of the population.

WRITING.TITLE: [Rant] Keto PSA for Scale Pics
WRITING.TEXT: [removed]
Wait...how did you find out about the magazine we found!? =)

You can lose weight by not restricting calories, yes, but it requires an expenditure of energy...i.e. exercise.
So, essentially, if you eat at maintenance calorie level, but you exercise to burn calories, you will lose weight.
It's hard to believe...but once you are fully in ketosis, you will be surprised at how easy it is to not indulge in those things you currently crave.
It's not about the keto, it's that she doesn't feel like her opinions matter to him.

Firstly, you are doing great, and the difference between your pictures is very dramatic.
Secondly, but just remember that your body is like a showcase to show people how committed you are to your health and well-being.
I couldn't agree less. That is a thought process that leads to eating disorders and an unhealthy body image.
If *your* reason to lose weight is to showcase yourself for others, that's perfectly fine...but just know that not everyone shares that mindset.
You can't leave that mess lying around! What kind of tournaments!? =)

WRITING.TITLE: [NSV] Outback restaurant and getting your hands dirty
WRITING.TEXT:
I took both of my kids to Outback this past weekend, because a) They've never been, and b) Steak!
I completely forgot about the bread they bring you before the meal!!! I used to LOVE that bread.
I was able to cut slices of the bread, spread butter on them, and hand them to my kids and see their expression of happiness at how yummy it was, and I still didn't have the urge to eat any myself. Thank you ketosis!
Since you're wondering, I had the Filet Mignon with a side of grilled asparagus, and a Blue Cheese Wedge Side Salad. =)

While I might tend to agree with you ashelia, taken out of context in their relationship.
The fact is, however, that there are many things we do or don't do in a relationship with a significant other in order to make things run more smoothly. Compromise, if you will.
Context means alot. Consider a wife that doesn't drive after sundown, "because my husband doesn't like it." Taken out of context, that might sounds abusive to her. What if the truth is that he had a traumatic accident himself due to night-related incidences, and instead of triggering his PTSD by driving at night, she chooses of her own accord to help him feel better by not driving at night? Not so abusive anymore...now it's a loving compromise.
Context!
